p: In the absence of competition, the effects of B. gigantea inoculation on native plant biomass (b 0) depended on the native plant species ( Table 3), increasing Dichanthelium biomass by 1.19 g (95% CI: 0.82 g–1.59 g; Fig 5A), decreasing Elymus biomass by 0.60 g (95% CI: -0.99 g–-0.22 g; Fig 5B), and having no significant effect on Eragrostis biomass (estimated change: -0.17 g, 95% CI: -0.55 g–0.20 g; Fig 5C) relative to the mock inoculation control. The effect of Microstegium density on native biomass (α) was consistent across the native species ( Table 3), with an average value of 2.08 plant -1 (95% CI: 0.61 plant -1–6.28 plant -1) in the mock inoculation treatment. There were no significant effects of B. gigantea inoculation on the responses of the three native species to increases in Microstegium density (average B. gigantea inoculation effect: -0.57 plant -1, 95% CI: -5.37 plant -1–3.48 plant -1).
